dt: {bc}to give special attention or prominence to (something)
{bc}to make (something) more emphatic, noticeable, or distinct

dt.t: columns that {wi}accent{/wi} the vertical lines of the building

dt: {bc}to pronounce (part of a word) with greater stress or force {bc}{sx|stress||}

dt.t: {wi}Accent{/wi} the second syllable of the word "before."

dt: {bc}to mark with a written or printed accent

et: borrowed from Middle French {it}accenter{/it} "to pronounce with greater stress," in part derivative of {it}accent{/it} {et_link|accent:1|accent:1}, in part borrowed from Medieval Latin {it}accentāre{/it}, variant of {it}accentuāre{/it} {ma}{mat|accentuate|}{/ma}
shortdef: to give special attention or prominence to (something) : to make (something) more emphatic, noticeable, or distinct
to pronounce (part of a word) with greater stress or force : stress
to mark with a written or printed accent
